guiSET.core

Class Control

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Slider, TextBased

    public abstract class Control
extends java.lang.Object
    (Abstract) Base class for all other visual components. It provides all basic style attributes and methods. It also comes with the essential event handling and some useful default rendering methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Functional interface for a lambda expression with two parameters.
      static class  Control.RenderingMethod
      guiSET provides two rendering methods and for each element, the method can be chosen.
      static class  Control.Setter<T>

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Name for the element can be specified manually, useful for distinguishing. This property has no effect on the looks.

      • FILL

        public static final Control.ImageMode FILL
        Image mode: fill element with given image and if necessary, distort the image

      • FIT

        public static final Control.ImageMode FIT
        Image mode: enlarge image so it fills out entire object centered, parts of the image might be hidden; fits the larger side

      • FIT_INSIDE

        public static final Control.ImageMode FIT_INSIDE
        Image mode: place image centered in the object without cropping it, so it fits the smaller side

      • BUFFERED_RENDERING

        public static final Control.RenderingMethod BUFFERED_RENDERING
        Elements graphics are drawn on a buffer image. This element needs to be re-rendered only if it changed and not if siblings or parents changed. This saves CPU resources but needs more memory.

      • UNBUFFERED_RENDERING

        public static final Control.RenderingMethod UNBUFFERED_RENDERING
        Elements graphics are drawn on parent buffer. Each change of any element makes a re-rendering of this element necessary. There are exceptions though: if this parents mode is BUFFERED_RENDERING and a sibling of the parent has changed, then the element that is buffered by the parent needs no redrawing.

      • defaultRenderingMethod

        public static Control.RenderingMethod defaultRenderingMethod
        Specify rendering type for any new element instances.

      • ANCHOR_INACTIVE

        public static final int ANCHOR_INACTIVE
        The value of an inactive anchor is set to ANCHOR_INACTIVE.

    • Method Detail

      • focus

        public void focus()
        Request the Frame component to focus this object. The Frame decides upon the demand and can set this elements focused state to true. There can only be one focused element at a time and it is stored in the Frames focusedElement property.
        See Also:
        Frame.focusedElement

      • blur

        public void blur()
        Request the Frame component to blur this object (set focus to false).
        See Also:
        Frame.focusedElement

      • unfocus

        public void unfocus()
        Request the Frame component to blur this object (set focus to false), duplicate of blur().
        See Also:
        Frame.focusedElement

      • setBoxShadow

        public void setBoxShadow(int size,
                         int offsetX,
                         int offsetY,
                         int color,
                         float opacity)
        Add rectangular box shadow to element.
        Parameters:
        size - shadow size
        offsetX - x offset
        offsetY - y offset
        color - shadow color
        opacity - shadow opacity (0 is transparent, 1 is opaque)

      • removeBoxShadow

        public void removeBoxShadow()

      • forceRepaint

        public void forceRepaint()
        Force a re-render of this Component. This shouldn't be needed, but just in case.

      • setAnchor

        public void setAnchor(int anchor,
                      int value)
        Set an anchor of type TOP BOTTOM, LEFT or RIGHT to a certain value. This also immediately sets the position or size of this element according to the anchors if necessary. It is not possible to use this method if this element has not been added to a parent container. This version sets the anchor without changing its type like setPercentageAnchor(int, int) and setPixelAnchor(int, int).
        Parameters:
        anchor - anchor direction
        value - value

      • setAnchors

        public void setAnchors(int... anchors_and_values)
        Set any number of anchors by passing first a direction and then the value (more than four - one for each direction - don't make sense though). The anchor mode (PIXEL_MODE or PERCENTAGE_MODE is not changed. Example: setAnchors(LEFT, 34, RIGHT, 50); setAnchors(BOTTOM, 0, LEFT, 1, RIGHT, 20, TOP, 50);
        Parameters:
        anchors_and_values - anchors and values

      • setPixelAnchor

        public void setPixelAnchor(int anchor,
                           int value)
        Set an anchor like with setAnchor(int, int) but definitely use the PIXEL_MODE. The anchor will be set to [value] pixels.
        Parameters:
        anchor - LEFT, RIGHT, TOP or BOTTOM
        value - value

      • setPixelAnchors

        public void setPixelAnchors(int... anchors_and_values)
        Combination of setAnchors(int...) and setPixelAnchor(int, int).
        Parameters:
        anchors_and_values - anchors and values

      • setPercentageAnchor

        public void setPercentageAnchor(int anchor,
                                int value)
        Set an anchor like in PERCENTAGE_MODE. This will place or resize the element in percent relative to the size of the parent (give i.e. 100 for 100%).
        Parameters:
        anchor - anchor
        value - value

      • setPercentageAnchors

        public void setPercentageAnchors(int... anchors_and_values)
        Combination of setAnchors(int...) and setPercentageAnchor(int, int).
        Parameters:
        anchors_and_values - anchors and values

      • getAnchorMode

        public boolean getAnchorMode(int anchor)
        Get anchor mode for given anchor direction. Returns a boolean PIXEL_MODE (false) or PERCENTAGE_MODE (true).
        Parameters:
        anchor - anchor direction
        Returns:
        anchor mode

      • getAnchorValue

        public int getAnchorValue(int anchor)
        Get the value of an anchor, returns ANCHOR_INACTIVE if the anchor is inactive.
        Parameters:
        anchor - anchor direction
        Returns:
        anchor value in pixel or percent, depending on corresponding nchor mode

      • addAutoAnchors

        public void addAutoAnchors(int... anchor)
        Add an anchor (types are TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, LEFT). Anchors ensure the element stays at fixed relative positions when the parent is resized. If opposite anchors are set, the element will be resized as well. When this function is called, the element will remember the CURRENT(!) distances to the parents bounds. Multiple anchors can be set with this method. This is currently only intended with PIXEL_MODE and not with PERCENTAGE_MODE (mode will be set to the PIXEL_MODE if the latter is currently selected). It is not possible to use this method if this element has not been added to a parent.
        Parameters:
        anchor - accepts TOP, RIGHT, LEFT or BOTTOM. Pass up to four anchor types (order doesn't matter)

      • removeAnchor

        public void removeAnchor(int anchor)
        Remove a set anchor. Removing the last anchor will set all anchor.
        Parameters:
        anchor - accepts TOP, RIGHT, LEFT or BOTTOM

      • fillParentWidth

        public void fillParentWidth(int percent)
        Fill x percent of parent width and center this element horizontally.
        Parameters:
        percent - percent 100 for 100%

        public void fillParentWidth()
        Fill parent width.

        x - x-coordinate in pixel

      • setY

        Set y-coordinate of element relative to parent. Does not apply if element is added to containers that provide some own layout.
        Parameters:
        y - y-coordinate in pixel

      • setZ

        public void setZ(int z)
        Set z-coordinate of element. Elements are sorted by z-index when overlapping on the screen.
        Parameters:
        z - z-index

      • setMinWidth

        public void setMinWidth(int minWidth)
        Set minimum width of element in pixel. Width of element will never be less than minWidth and therefore might be adjusted. Minimum width cannot be smaller than 1 and not greater than minWidth.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - minimum width in pixel

      • setMaxWidth

        public void setMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Set maximum width of element in pixel. Width of element will never be greater than maxWidth. Default is 100000.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - maximum width in pixel

      • setMinHeight

        public void setMinHeight(int minHeight)
        Set minimum height of element in pixel. Height of element will never be less than minHeight and therefore might be adjusted. Minimum height cannot be smaller than 1 and not greater than maxHeight.
        Parameters:
        minHeight - minimum height in pixel

      • setMaxHeight

        public void setMaxHeight(int maxHeight)
        Set maximum height of element in pixel. Height of element will never be greater than maxHeight. Default is 100000.
        Parameters:
        maxHeight - maximum height in pixel

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int clr)
        Set the plain background color of the element. Actual displayed color can vary if the element is i.e. hovered over.
        Parameters:
        clr - integer rgb color

                        int bottomColor)

        Parameters:
        topColor - top gradient color
        bottomColor - bottom gradient color

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set the enabled state of this element. If false it will not receive any events and be displayed in a different (mostly greyish) way.
        Parameters:
        enabled - enabled state

      • setVisible

        Set the visibility. Invisible elements will not be rendered and receive not events.

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(double opacity)
        Set opacity (opposite of transparency), casts to float.
        Parameters:
        opacity - opacity from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(float opacity)
        Set opacity (opposite of transparency). Transparent elements are still clickable (like in html), even if the opacity is 0. Call setVisibility(false) or setEnabled(false) to prevent the element from receiving mouse events.
        Parameters:
        opacity - opacity from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).

        Parameters:

      • copyStyle

        public void copyStyle(Control source)
        Enable user of the library to adopt a set of visual properties from another element. @see copyStyle(Control, long).
        Parameters:
        source - element to adopt properties from.

      • copyStyle

        public void copyStyle(Control source,
                      long attribs)
        Enable user of the library to adopt a set of visual style properties from another element. Call copyStyle(Control, attribs) to read given attributes (separated by bitwise OR) from given element c: myElement.copyStyle(otherElement, PADDING_LEFT | MARGIN_BOTTOM, FOREGROUND_COLOR);

        Options are: PADDING_LEFT, PADDING_RIGHT, PADDING_TOP, PADDING_BOTTOM, MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_BOTTOM, BACKGROUND_COLOR, HOVER_COLOR, PRESSED_COLOR, FOREGROUND_COLOR, BORDER_WIDTH, BORDER_RADIUS, BORDER_COLOR, OPACITY,

        Only if source and target have text properties: TEXT_COLOR, TEXT_ALIGN, TEXT_ALIGN_Y, FONT_SIZE, LINE_HEIGHT.

        There some shortcuts to include several properties, like ALL, COLORS, MARGIN (all margins), PADDING (all paddings), SPACING (all margins and paddings), BACKGROUND_COLORS (background-, hover-, and pressedColor), BORDER (border-width, -color and -radius), TEXT_PROPERTIES (all text properties).
        Parameters:
        source - element to adopt properties from.
        attribs - bitwise OR added attributes

      • doForAll

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> void doForAll(Control.Setter<T> setter,
                                              T... elements)
        (A bit more advanced!) Do a given method for all given objects (not necessarily UI elements). The idea is to apply setters to several elements without boilerplate code.
        You can pass an instance of Control.Setter<>, override its run() method and then pass any number of elements.
        You need to specify an object class, i.e. Control if you only need to use methods from Control or Textbox, if you would like to use setters individual to Textbox.
        Example: 

         Control.doForAll(new Control.Setter<Control>() {
     @Override
     public void run(Control c) {
         c.setBackgroundColor(color(0)); 
     }
 }, myButton, myLabel, myTextbox);


        or: 
         Control.doForAll(new Control.Setter<Container>() {
     @Override
     public void run(Container c) {
         c.fitContent(); 
     }
 }, myContainer, myHScrollContainer, myScrollArea, myFlowContainer);
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of object
        Parameters:
        setter - a setter (need to override the run() method and specify template type)
        elements - arbitrary number of elements that are of the given template type

      • animate

        public void animate(java.lang.String attribute,
                    float aimedValue,
                    double milliseconds)
        Create a transition animation for a property of this Component. The Frame will deal with changing this property in appropriate steps to create the effect. I.e. write: myObject.animate("x", 50, 500); to change the x-coordinate of myObject to 50 within half a second. Or myObject.animate("opacity", 0, 100); to create a fade-out transition.
        Parameters:
        attribute - name of attribute to animate
        aimedValue - final value for the attribute
        milliseconds - time for animation in milliseconds

      • setMouseListener

        public boolean setMouseListener(java.lang.String type,
                                java.lang.String methodName)
        Set a mouse listener. The type can be "press", "release", "enter", "exit, "move", "drag" and "wheel". Each Component allows one listener per type. The given method can be implemented without arguments or with MouseEvent as parameter. If it is defined in another class than in the main PApplet scope use the overloaded method setMouseListener(String, String, Object) that allows passing a target object.
        Parameters:
        type - String for event type
        methodName - Name of method to invoke
        Returns:
        false if type is invalid, method is not accessible or a listener has already been registered for this type. Returns true if successful.

      • setMouseListener

        public boolean setMouseListener(java.lang.String type,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target)
        Allows to pass a target object where the given method is declared.
        Parameters:
        type - String for event type
        methodName - name of callback method
        target - Object where the callback method is declared.
        Returns:
        false if type is invalid, method is not accessible or a listener has already been registered for this type. Returns true if successful.
        See Also:
        setMouseListener(String, String)

      • setMouseListener

                             Control.Predicate lambda)

        Parameters:

      • stopPropagation

        public static void stopPropagation()
        Stop mouse event propagation. If called then no Components lower or at the same level in the Container hierachy will receive the currently processed mouse event.
